case_title: SETH BANARSI DAS GUPTA vs INCOME TAX OFFICER, MEERUT

questions_of_law.question_1: Whether, on the facts and in the circumstances of the case, depreciation is allowable on the l/6th share in S.B. Sugar Mills, Bijnor, which the assessee had acquired from Seth Shiv Prasad?
questions_of_law.question_2: Whether, on the facts and in the circumstances of the case, the Tribunal was justified in holding that the loss of Rs. 3,90,750 arising on sales of shares of M/s. Jaswant Sugar Mills Ltd, was loss of capital nature?

answers.question_1: The assessee was not entitled to depreciation on the l/6th share in S.B. Sugar Mills, Bijnor.
answers.question_2: The Tribunal was justified in holding that the loss of Rs. 3,90,750 arising on sales of shares of M/s. Jaswant Sugar Mills Ltd. was loss of capital nature.

legal_references.case: Seth Banarsi Das Gupta v. Commissioner of Income Tax [1971] 81 ITR 170 (All)
Investment Ltd. v. Commissioner of Income-tax [1970] 77 ITR 533 (SC)
legal_references.application: Not applicable to the present case.

legal_references.case: Raj Kishen Pretn Chandra Jain v. Commissioner of Income-tax [1959] 35 ITR 590 (Punj)
legal_references.application: Not applicable to the present case.
